column4: it looks like you tried to install it by hand (not via apt or synaptic), or build it from source
what do you need it for?
libssh2 is probably the package you need
if you're trying to compile a package that's not in the repositories, try to install all of its dependencies via synaptic as much as possible
so for instance, if it needs libssh2, then you'd search for that in synaptic, and install any -dev packages you find
libssh2-1-dev and libssh-2-dev, in this case
one of hydra's dependencies is libssh v0.11
.11 exactly, or just that or better?
do you know that it won't work with libssh2-1-dev?
i KNOW that it needs libssh v0.11
hydra-5.4?
c
am i crazy?  am i missing something?
one sec
oh!  figured it out
i downloaded libssh-0.2.tgz and it has the right libs to get hydra to work right
thanks for the help
one thing I want to point out is that downloading a binary library that a tool of such provenance is rather sketchy from a security standpoint
hmmm, you mean as it's outdated and may have security holes or something?
no, more that it could include backdoors
i see
would it be better not to mess with it?
there are other tools available, but I'd definately try to stick to trustable sources, or else keep that binary contained on a seperate machine
